meanings.definition: Enclosed in a capsule or similar structure.
meanings.sent1: The tiny seeds were encapsulated within a protective shell.
meanings.sent2: The medicine was stored in an encapsulated form for easy consumption.
meanings.sent3: The encapsulated vitamins looked like little treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were encapsulated in a bubble, shielded from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The encapsulated memories brought a sense of nostalgia.

meanings.sent1: Can you encapsulate the main points of the story in a few sentences?
meanings.sent2: She encapsulated her entire argument in a single paragraph.
meanings.sent3: Trying to encapsulate a complex idea in a tweet can be challenging.
meanings.sent4: His speech encapsulated the essence of the issue at hand.
meanings.sent5: The infographic encapsulated the data in a visually appealing way.

meanings.definition: To encapsulate something in a protective coating.
meanings.sent1: The scientist encapsulated the fragile specimen in a sturdy casing.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to encapsulate the electronic components for durability.
meanings.sent3: The artist encapsulated the delicate flower in resin to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent4: The chef encapsulated the dish in a flavorful sauce.
meanings.sent5: The team encapsulated the fragile artifact in a glass display case.
